text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-Encounter.location

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionList of locations where the patient has been
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:location 1..1ExtensionLocation the encounter takes place
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Encounter.location.location"
value[x] 1..1Reference(Cross-version Profile for R5.Location for use in FHIR R4 | Location)Location the encounter takes place
extension:status 0..1Extensionplanned | active | reserved | completed
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Encounter.location.status"
value[x] 0..1codeplanned | active | reserved | completed
extension:form 0..1ExtensionThe physical type of the location (usually the level in the location hierarchy - bed, room, ward, virtual etc.)
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Encounter.location.form"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe physical type of the location (usually the level in the location hierarchy - bed, room, ward, virtual etc.)
extension:period 0..1ExtensionTime period during which the patient was present at the location
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Encounter.location.period"
value[x] 0..1PeriodTime period during which the patient was present at the location
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-Encounter.location"
value[x] 0..0Value of extension

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionEncounter_Location
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.Encounter.location` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Encounter.location` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `Encounter.location` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`Encounter.location` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `Encounter.location` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `Encounter.location` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `Encounter.location` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `Encounter.location` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Encounter.location`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: List of locations where the patient has been
element.definition: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.
element.comment: Virtual encounters can be recorded in the Encounter by specifying a location reference to a location of type "kind" such as "client's home" and an encounter.class = "virtual".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The location where the encounter takes place.
element.requirements:
Element `Encounter.location.location` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Encounter.location` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Encounter.location.location` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Encounter.location.location`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: The location where the encounter takes place.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.
element.comment: When the patient is no longer active at a location, then the period end date is entered, and the status may be changed to completed.
element.requirements:
Element `Encounter.location.status` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Encounter.location` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Encounter.location.status` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Encounter.location.status`, but has no comparisons.

element.definition: The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.
element.comment: When the patient is no longer active at a location, then the period end date is entered, and the status may be changed to completed.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The physical type of the location (usually the level in the location hierarchy - bed, room, ward, virtual etc.)
element.definition: This will be used to specify the required levels (bed/ward/room/etc.) desired to be recorded to simplify either messaging or query.
element.comment:
This information is de-normalized from the Location resource to support the easier understanding of the encounter resource and processing in messaging or query.

There may be many levels in the hierachy, and this may only pic specific levels that are required for a specific usage scenario.
